summary: This document is a timeline and investigative report into the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. It details his suicide watch history, an alleged prior suicide attempt, and failures in protocol including the failure to reassign a cellmate and falsification of inmate count slips and 30-minute check sheets.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the death investigation. The document tracks his intake, suicide risk assessments, alleged suicide attempt, and the circumstances leading to his death in custody.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Intake and Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein undergoes intake processing and is placed under psychological observation.

events.title: First Suicide Risk Assessment and SHU Transfer
events.description: Epstein undergoes his first suicide risk assessment and is transferred to the Special Housing Unit (SHU).

events.title: Alleged Suicide Attempt
events.description: Epstein allegedly attempts suicide while in custody.

events.title: Suicide Watch Begins
events.description: Following the alleged attempt, Epstein is placed on suicide watch for 31 hours and 5 minutes.

events.title: Psychological Observation Period
events.description: Epstein is placed under psychological observation from July 24 to July 29.

events.title: Transfer to SHU with Cellmate
events.description: Epstein is transferred back to the SHU, this time with a cellmate.

events.title: Second Suicide Risk Assessment
events.description: Epstein undergoes a second suicide risk assessment.

events.title: Failure to Reassign Cellmate
events.description: Epstein's cellmate leaves for court at 8:00 a.m. Multiple guards and supervisors fail to notice Epstein is alone or reassign a cellmate. Epstein returns from an attorney conference at 6:45 p.m. and makes an unrecorded 17-minute phone call at 7:18 p.m.

locations: MCC NEW YORK SPECIAL HOUSING UNIT (SHU)
keyFacts: The document outlines a detailed timeline of Epstein's custody, suicide watch, and psychological observation from July 6 to August 9, 2019.
It highlights a critical failure on August 9, 2019, where 9 guards and 3 supervisors did not ensure Epstein had a cellmate after his previous one left for court.
The report indicates falsification of official count slips and 30-minute check sheets at the MCC, suggesting a breakdown in security protocols.
Epstein was allowed to make an unrecorded 17-minute phone call on the evening of August 9, 2019, shortly before his death.
